Trait description: Color of the flower
Method description: Visual observation

Trait description: Height of the plant described as the distance between the soil and the plant canopy
Method description: Measure the height of the plant from the soil surface to the canopy at the end of flowering and calculate the mean canopy height of five representative plants

Trait description: Seed yield at maturity (g per plot)
Method description: Weight of seed harvested from each plot

Trait description: Weight of seed per unit of area
Method description: Weight of seed harvested from each plot

Trait description: Weight of seeds obtained from a plant.
Method description: Averaged weight of air-dried seeds harvested from each plant

Trait description: Weight of a seed
Method description: Count 100 well-developed whole air-dried seeds and weigh

Trait description: Seed yield at maturity (kg ha-1)
Method description: Weight of harvested seeds on a plot divided by the surface of the plot

Trait description: Weight of seed per unit of area
Method description: Weight of harvested seeds on a plot divided by the surface of the plot

Trait description: Causative agent:Fusarium oxysporum f.sp.ciceris. It causes seedlings to die, seedlings collapse and lie flat on the ground, when uprooted plants show uneven shrinking of the stem above and below the collar region
Method description: Proportion of dead plants in a plot due to fusarium wilt

Trait description: Causative agent:Ascochyta rabiei. It causes dark brown lesions at the base of the stem of emerging seedlings, seen during the flowering and podding phases of blighted plants in the field, affected seedlings die
Method description: Visual assessment of the resistaance to the disease

Trait description: Number of days from sowing to when 50% of the plants have started flowering
Method description: Counting the number of days from sowing to 50% of plants started flowering

Trait description: Time elpased from sowing to flowering
Method description: Counting the number of days from sowing to 50% of plants started flowering

Trait description: Time elpased from sowing to maturity
Method description: Counting the number of days from sowing to maturity

Trait description: Number of plants per experimental unit
Method name: Plant number per pot or plot - Method
Method description: Counting number of plants per experimental unit (pot or plot)

Trait description: Number of plants per experimental unit
Method description: Counting number of plants per plot

Trait description: Number of pods counted per plant
Method description: Average number of pods from 3 or 5 randomly selected plants

Trait description: Number of seeds per pod from a plant
Method description: Ratio between seed number per plant and pod number per plant.

Trait description: Growth habit of the plant
Method description: Visual observation at mid-pod filling stage of the angle of primary branches

Trait description: Color of the seed coat. It can describe the main color of the seed coat (e.g., black, brown, green, yellow, white), its different color shades, its combination of colors
Method description: Visual observation of the color

Trait description: Number of seeds per plant
Method description: Number of seeds counted per plant

Trait description: Type of chickpea e.g., desi, kabuli or intermediate
Method description: Visual assessment

Trait description: Proportion of grain yield over total biomass yield
Method description: Proportion of grain yield over total biomass yield by dividing the weight of harvested grain by the weight of harvested biomass

Trait description: The dry weight of the whole plant (excluding roots)
Method description: At harvest, weigh an oven or sun dried plant (excluding roots)

Trait description: Width of the plant i.e., the spread of the plant canopy
Method description: Measuring of the plant canopy spread, average fronm 3 or 5 plants randomly selected plants at maturity

Trait description: Number of flowers per peduncle
Method name: Number of flowers per peduncle - Method
Method description: Visual observation of the number of flowers per peduncle

Trait description: Seed diameter of fully dried seed
Method description: Diameter of fully dried seed is measured using vernier caliper

Trait description: Shape of the seed e.g., angular/pea shaped/owl's head
Method description: Visual observation

Trait description: The extent of damage caused by the pod borer. Causative agent:Helicoverpa armigera. The insect feeds on all green parts and defoliate young crops, large larvae cut round holes in the pod wall and devour the seed inside.
Method description: Damage at pod stage measured by counting total pods and damaged pods and calculating proportion of damaged pods

Trait description: Number of days from sowing to appearnce of first flower
Method description: Counting the number of days from sowing to appearnce of first floewer

Trait description: Time elpased from sowing to flowering
Method description: Counting the number of days from sowing to appearnce of first floewer

Trait description: Degree of tolerance to cold
Method description: Cold tolerance index calculated by dividing the percentage of filled pods of the cold-stressed plants by that of the control plants.

Trait name: No. of fertile pods per plant
Trait description: Number of pods with seed
Method name: No. of fertile pods per plant - Method
Method description: Average number of pods with seed from 3 or 5 randomly selected plants

Trait description: Extent of anthocyanin pigmentation in the plant
Method description: Visual observation of the extent of anthocyanin pigmentation on stem and leaves at flowering

Trait description: Surface of the seed e.g., rough, smooth, tuberculated
Method description: Visual observation of the surface of the seed (e.g., rough, smooth, tuberculated)

Trait description: The dry weight of the plant (excluding roots) harvested from an area
Method description: Taking weight of oven or sun dried plant (excluding roots) of a plot

Trait description: Period during which plants continue to flower
Method description: Counting the number of days from first flower to end of flowering

Trait description: Protein content of the whole seed
Method description: In laboratory, analyse the whole seed crude protein content

Trait description: Cooking time for dry seed without soaking
Method description: Number of Minutes taken for seed to cook

Trait description: Weight of the shoot without roots
Method description: Measuring the weight of the total shoot above ground

Trait description: Height of the canopy
Method description: Average canopy height of three/five representative plants of an accession.

Trait description: Vigor of the plant growth charaterized by the plant height and shoot biomass
Method description: At 10-15 days after emergence, observe the growth vigor visually

Trait description: Dry weight of the root
Method description: Weight of oven-dried roots from a plant

Trait description: Causative agent:Sclerotium rolfsii. It causes constriction of collar region and rotting. White strands grow over affected tissue. Sclerotia, small round fungal structures that look like mustard seeds, are seen on the dead tissues
Method description: Proportion of dead plants in a plot due to collar rot

Trait description: Causative agent:Botrytis cinerea. It causes water soaked and irregular lesions on the pod that contain either small shriveled seeds or no seeds at all, lesions girdle the stem completely
Method description: Visual estimation of the resistance to the disease

Trait description: Causative agent: Liriomyza cicerina. The leaflets are mined, have a reduced photosynthetic capacity and senesce prematurely.
Method description: Visual estimation of the resistance to the disease

Trait description: Type of leaf of the plant e.g., normal/simple/multipinnate
Method description: Classification of leaf type based on visual observation

Trait description: Causative agent:Rhizoctonia bataticola. It causes drying up of plants. Roots become brittle and minute sclerotia are seen on the exposed roots
Method description: Proportion of dead plants in a plot due to dry root rot

Trait description: Time elapsed between sowing and pod formation
Method name: Days to first pod formation - Method
Method description: Counting the number of days from sowing to first pod formation

Trait description: Causative agent:Colletotrichum capsici. It causes elongated, sunken, dark brown spots on the lower part of the stem, wilting and drying due to severe infection
Method description: Visual estimation of the resistance to the disease

Trait description: Length of pods
Method description: Average length of 9 randomly chosen pods, 3 each from 3 randomly-selected plants at mid-pod filling stage

Trait description: Weight of pods from a plant
Method description: Average weight from 3 or 5 randomly-selected plants at maturity

Trait description: Number of plants in a productive unit
Method description: Count taken within a plot

Trait description: Degree of tolerance to high temperature
Method description: Heat tolerance index calculated by dividing the percentage of filled pods of the heat-stressed plants by that of the control plants.

Trait description: Causative agent: Pea leaf roll virus. It causes stunted growth and discoloured (yellow, orange or brown) foliage
Method description: Visual estimation of the resistance to the disease

Trait description: Taste of seed for Consuming
Method description: Tasting the Seed with at least 10 Persons

Trait description: Cumulative root length of a sample
Method description: Usually measured through winrhizo software from scanned image files or maually using a measuring scale

Trait description: Degree of tolerance to soil salinity
Method description: Salinity tolerance index calculated by dividing the biomass or grain yield of the plants grown under saline conditions by that of the control plants.

Trait description: Rooting depth of the plant
Method description: Measured in field pits or containers

Trait description: Causative agent: Heterodera spp. Syncytia are formed on the roots which become necrotic.
Method description: Visual estimation of the resistance to the disease

Trait name: Apical primary branches number per plant
Trait description: Number of apical primary branches per plant
Trait synonyms: Number of apical primary branches per plant
Method description: Mean number of apical primary branches from 3 or 5 randomly selected plants at maturity

Trait name: Apical secondary branches number per plant
Trait description: Number of apical secondary branches per plant
Trait synonyms: Number of apical secondary branches per plant
Method description: Mean number of apical secondary branches from 3 or 5 randomly selected plants at maturity

Trait name: Basal primary branches number per plant
Trait description: Number of basal primary branches per plant
Trait synonyms: Number of basal primary branches per plant
Method description: Mean number of basal primary branches from 3 or 5 randomly selected plants at maturity

Trait name: Basal secondary branches number per plant
Trait description: Number of basal secondary branches per plant
Trait synonyms: Number of basal secondary branches per plant
Method description: Mean number of basal secondary branches from 3 or 5 randomly selected plants at maturity

Trait description: Number of tertiary branches per plant
Trait synonyms: Number of tertiary branches per plant
Method description: Number of tertiary branches from 3 or 5 randomly selected plants at maturity

Trait description: Trait indicating the presence or absence of dots on the seed coat.
Method description: Visual observation (present, absent)

Trait description: Shoot sodium content from plants/subset of plants.
Method description: Determination of Sodium content by using nitric acid digestion method (AAS & ICP-OES) at vegetative stage

Trait description: Shoot potassium content from plants/subset of plants.
Method description: Determination of potassium content by using nitric acid digestion method (AAS & ICP-OES) at vegetative stage

Trait description: Is a count of the number of filled chickpea double pods produced by a double podded line.
Method description: Counting of number of filled double pods produced by a double-podded genotype

Trait description: Type of leaflet margin e.g., smooth, serrated
Method description: Visual observation

Trait description: Number of leaflets in a fully developed leaf
Method name: Number of leaflets per leaf - Method
Method description: Average of 9 leaves (from the median part of the plant), 3 each from 3 randomly-selected plants at mid-pod filling stage.

Trait description: Extent of hairiness of the shoot
Method description: Visual observation on intensity of trichomes on the shoot

Trait description: Causative agent: Alternaria alternata. It causes water-soaked purple lesions on leaflets which later turn brown to dark brown
Method description: Visual estimation of the resistance to the disease

Trait description: Causative agent: Meloidogyne spp. It causes formation of galls on the root
Method description: Visual estimation of the resistance to the disease

Trait description: Stem Dry Weight of a sample
Method description: Stem dry weight taken after seperation and oven drying at 80âˆžC for at least 3 days

Trait description: Leaf Dry Weight of a sample
Method description: Leaf dry weight taken after seperation and oven drying at 80âˆžC for at least 3 days

Trait name: Root dry weight/total plant dry weight
Trait description: Ratio of Root Dry weight to that of the whole plant dry weight
Attribute: Root dry weight/total plant dry weight
Method name: Root dry weight/total plant dry weight - Method
Method description: Calculated using both root and shoot dry weights.

Trait description: The length of roots present in a unit volume of soil
Method description: Calculated using both root length measured and soil volume from where the root comes.

Trait description: Surface of roots
Method description: Calculated through length and diameter measured through winrhizo software

Trait description: Volume of root
Method description: Calculated through length and diameter measured through winrhizo software

Trait description: Ratio of carbon isotope in tissue relative to the air
Method description: Ratio of C13/C12 in leaf in relation to the air

Trait description: Leaf area per dry weight of leaves
Method description: Ratio of area to the weight of leaves. Leaf area is measured using leaf area meters and leaf weight using precision balances

Trait description: Chlorophyll content in the leaf
Method description: Using SPAD chlorophyll meter

Trait description: Ratio of shoot biomass produced per unit of transpired water
Method description: Shoot biomass is harvested and weighed and the water used during the growing time is calculated using initial and final weight of the containers

Trait description: Ratio of shoot biomass produced per unit of water lost from the field through both transpiration and evaporation
Method description: Shoot biomass is harvested and weighed and the water used during the growing time is calculated using initial and final soil weights plus the rainfall

Variable Xref: Field Crops Research.2010 119: 322-330, Plant Genetic Resources.2011 9 (1): 59-69.
Trait description: Standard residual after removing the effects of flowering time and yield potential advantages from the drought yields
Method description: Drought yield is assumed as a function of days to flowering, yield potential and residual in a multiple regression approach. The standardized residual is considered as drought tolerance index

Trait description: This is to identify traits related to the anatomy of the plant.
This will help identify traits related to pigmentation.
Root dry weight of a sample
Method description: Dry weight taken after extracting roots from soil

Trait description: Is a count of the number of pods per plant grown in the pot or field.
Method description: Average number of pods from 3 or 5 randomly selected plants
